page.title: 12NEW ABBEY - LANDSCAPE
page.content: The landscape consists of farmland, forest, hill and sea. The area supports nine farms with rich pasture for dairy, beef and sheep farming. The farmers produce their own grass to feed the animals and spare fields belonging to other landowners are often let out for grazing. The nearness of the sea makes the climate mild and enables gardeners to grow good crops and beautiful flowers. On the lower slopes of the hills are acres of coniferous forest, but all over the area are beech, oak, ash and other deciduous trees. From every hill, but especially from Criffell (l866 ft), one can look down on the village of New Abbey nestling among the trees, with the Pow flowing towards the sea and the ruins of Sweetheart Abbey standing quietly by.
